title: Tensorboard Logger; Log weights and distributions.

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body: ## ðŸš€ Feature Request Simply add a new function in the `TensorboardLogger(ILogger)` code that allows to add histograms to Tensorboard. This allows better logging in Tensorboard. ### Motivation I often use the histogram in my deep learning projects and having this feature within the Tensorboard class will allow me to improve my logging in catalyst-dl. It is not particuarly hard to implement and I have provided the code below. ### Proposal ``` def log_weights( self, runner: "IRunner", ) -> None: """Logs model weights to Tensorboard for current epoch.""" assert runner.loader_key is not None # check saving weights is possible if 'named_parameters' in dir(runner.model): self._check_loader_key(loader_key=runner.loader_key) # log weights of model for name, params in runner.model.named_parameters(): # save weights as histogram self.loggers[runner.loader_key].add_histogram( tag=name, values=params, global_step=runner.epoch_step,\ bins='tensorflow' ) ``` I call the above function in a custom callback: ``` class TbSave(dl.Callback): def __init__(self, input_key='features', log_weights=True): super().__init__(order=dl.CallbackOrder.External) # key of input to be saved self.input_key=input_key self.log_weights = log_weights self.train_batch = 1 self.test_batch = 1 def save_inputs(self, runner): """ Save all the inputs as images, uses tensorboard. """ # train flag train = runner.is_train_loader # save from train flag if train: tag = 'train/' + str(self.train_batch) else: tag = 'test/' + str(self.test_batch) # get images from key images = runner.batch[self.input_key] # make grid of batch, # permute (CHW) -> (HWC) grid = torchvision.utils.make_grid(images).permute(1, 2, 0).numpy() # log the image runner.loggers['tb2'].log_image(runner=runner, image=grid, tag=tag) def on_epoch_end(self, runner): """ On epoch end. """ assert 'tb2' in runner.loggers.keys() # reset batch self.train_batch = 1 self.test_batch = 1 # save weights of model runner.loggers['tb2'].log_weights(runner=runner) def on_batch_end(self, runner): """ On batch end. Input: runner """ assert 'tb2' in runner.loggers.keys() # record inputs and outputs on first epoch if (runner.epoch_step == 1) and ('tb2' in runner.loggers.keys()): self.save_inputs(runner) # + batch for tags to save if runner.is_train_loader: self.train_batch += 1 else: self.test_batch += 1 ``` However this implementation would be greatly simplified by having the function within the logger class. That way I do not need to ensure `assert 'tb2' in runner.loggers.keys()`. ### Alternatives I considered using a new custom logger but this did not integrate with other loggers and Tensorboard's file compression massively saves space. ### Additional context Here is what the output looks like: ### Checklist - [x ] feature proposal description - [ x] motivation - [ x] extra proposal context / proposal alternatives review ### FAQ Please review the FAQ before submitting an issue: - [x ] I have read the [documentation and FAQ](https://catalyst-team.github.io/catalyst/) - [x ] I have reviewed the [minimal examples section](https://github.com/catalyst-team/catalyst#minimal-examples) - [x ] I have checked the [changelog](https://github.com/catalyst-team/catalyst/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) for main framework updates - [x ] I have read the [contribution guide](https://github.com/catalyst-team/catalyst/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [x ] I have joined [Catalyst slack (#__questions channel)](https://join.slack.com/t/catalyst-team-core/shared_invite/zt-d9miirnn-z86oKDzFMKlMG4fgFdZafw) for issue discussion
